[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/peer_manager/senders.rs] [Function: send_to()] [Message duplication] Does the channel guarantee at-most-once delivery, or can network layer retries combined with send_to() cause duplicate consensus votes that violate AptosBFT safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/peer_manager/senders.rs] [Function: send_to()] [PeerId spoofing] Can an attacker craft a fake PeerId that matches a validator's ID to intercept or redirect consensus messages, causing Byzantine behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/peer_manager/senders.rs] [Function: send_to()] [Protocol mismatch] If protocol_id in the tuple key doesn't match protocol_id in Message struct, which one takes precedence, and can this inconsistency be exploited for message routing attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/peer_manager/senders.rs] [Function: send_to()] [No acknowledgment] Since this is fire-and-forget, can critical consensus messages be silently dropped without detection, causing validators to miss votes and triggering unnecessary round timeouts? (High)
